Professionalism displayed in food presentation, quality & quantity and great service. About the latter, I cannot help but to name a Chef, CB, from one of the stations. We wanted to take a look at the buffet spread and had some questions. He greeted us and did more than explaining to us but showed us around the spreads and different stations, informing what kinds of food served. We thanked him but he actually stunned us by walking us out, wished us Good Night, and hoped we could try the buffet. Because of CB, we had actually cancelled a dinner reservation at a highly acclaimed restaurant but preferred to have the buffet dinner at our Hotel. reviewComments:
The hotel lobby was overwhelmingly volumnous, with big columns and large open spaces. Lots of seating lounges for chats and coffee too. Rooms are just about right sizes for deluxe but it feels clean, maybe it is still new. The lighting is also very well placed and makes the room feel homey. The low shelving below the TV provides more accessible space to place small luggages, ideal for couple on short term stay as the usual single luggage table in most hotels are inadequate. 

Staff are super friendly and helpful. I guess it is generally true for most hotels in Thailand. However, on our departure day, the front door/porter staff by name of Ton was particularly helpful to our plight. A day earlier, I had visited and ordered those ready in 1 day suit shop and was promised all to be done up by 2pm the next day (the day we are to leave Bangkok). To cut the long story short, they can't make it. Ton got to know this while trying to arrange transport for us to airport and immediately ask for the shop contact. He then proceeded to call the shop and spoke to the person (which is extremely helpful in this situation due to language barrier). He then assured us that he will make sure we reach the airport in time for our flight while liasing with the shop on progress and alternative. We waited as long as we could and he proceeded to arrange taxi to send us to airport (with about half an hour to spare after going through Bangkok's notorious traffic jam). He also promised to contact the shop after we left to arrange for delivery (which the shop called me the next day). 

It is a wonderful stay and the friendly staffs make all the difference. The only thing bad is, the 2 nights stay is too short. On a bright note, it gives us reason to return the next time.

reviewNegatives: As the hotel is new one could expect small chaos - booked two rooms and one was lost, not able to check in until 18.00 as they have not finished cleaning (To the hotel's defense,  we were compensated appropriately). Called housekeeper for some missing amenity but never arrived. However I believe things should improve along time. What really annoyed me was the poor soundproof of the room: one can hear everything that happens on the corridor: conversation, doorbell of another room, lifts, etc. It was unfortunate that we were sharing the corridor with some less considerate family guests: Loud bangs from slamming doors as well as children running on the corridor were really disturbing early morning and late nights. This is really something I wouldn't expect for a hotel of such level. The hotel also accommodates big travel groups, so breakfast place can get busy.
reviewPositives: The place is practically brand new. Staff was excellent -- very warm, attentive and helpful. Convenient location near BTS and shopping. When they finish the back entrance leading to the park, the walking distance to BTS will be even shorter. Facilities were not all ready yet but the ones available (pool, gym, restaurants) were really nice.
